title: Micron, Nike, BlackBerry, Braze: What to Watch When the Stock Market Opens Today; Micron Technology beat analyst forecasts in quarterly results; BlackBerry earnings are due after the close
text:
* Nvidia rose 3.1%. The chip designer has lost 15% this month after its effort to buy Arm Holdings faced a setback in the U.S. Even after that drop, the stock's up more than a third for the final quarter of 2021.

* Semiconductor company Advanced Micro Devices also gained ahead of the bell, adding 2.3%. Microchip Technology gained 1.1%.

* Nike rose 4.1% premarket after a mixed set of results. Revenue of $11.4 billion in the quarter ended Nov. 30 was up 1% from the same period last year. Growth was stunted by a slowdown in production and transportation of its goods around the world.

* General Mills fell 5.4% after the food company reported second-quarter profit that fell short of expectations

* Software company Braze added 15% premarket after saying its revenue rose 63% on the year in the third quarter. Braze listed on the Nasdaq Stock Market last month.

* Shares of Society Pass jumped 2.3% premarket after more than tripling Monday. The company, which went public in November, was added to the Russell 2000 index.

* Carnival rose 2.5% in another choppy premarket session for the cruise stock, a bellwether for investor sentiment regarding the Omicron variant of coronavirus.

* BlackBerry will deliver its earnings report after the close.

Chart of the Day

* Say this much for Oracle: When they get a line of credit, they waste no time in using it, writes Dan Gallagher for Heard on the Street.

Write to Joe Wallace at joe.wallace@wsj.com
